channel.title: CentOS VPS - Help me ASAP
channel.description: I uploaded all of my files to my CentOS VPS. Nothing I edit shows up, including edits you don't have to compile for. When I do compile, I use the code [code]"/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_25/bin/javac" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar:deps/jython.jar:deps/xstream.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/poi.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java [/code] What's wrong? Also, NPC's such as rock crabs aren't appearing even though they were when I was hosting the files locally.

item.title: CentOS VPS - Help me ASAP
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

DaGamerChild:

Can’t find server.server when I compile, but I checked and it’s case-proper.

Do you mean your run script cannot find server.server? Your compiler compiles the code it doesn’t run it.

[quote=“DaGamerChild, post:1, topic:525107”]I uploaded all of my files to my CentOS VPS. Nothing I edit shows up, including edits you don’t have to compile for. When I do compile, I use the code "/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_25/bin/javac" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar:deps/jython.jar:deps/xstream.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/poi.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java
What’s wrong? Also, NPC’s such as rock crabs aren’t appearing even though they were when I was hosting the files locally.[/quote]

Now I am just wondering why you have two different separators. Switch all the \ to /.

Read full topic

Is the server able to read your config file path properly? Linux file paths are case sensitive.

item.title: CentOS VPS - Help me ASAP

item.description:
@DaGamerChild wrote:

I uploaded all of my files to my CentOS VPS. Nothing I edit shows up, including edits you don’t have to compile for.
